body:
**Actionable comments posted: 4** > [!CAUTION] > Some comments are outside the diff and can‚Äôt be posted inline due to platform limitations. > > > >
> ‚ö†Ô∏è Outside diff range comments (3)
> >
> .claude/hooks/session_start_continuity.py (1)
> > `242-247`: **Remove redundant "python" argument from uv run command.** > > When using `uv run` on a Python script, the Python interpreter is automatically invoked. The explicit "python" argument is redundant and deviates from standard `uv run` usage patterns. > > > >
> ‚ôªÔ∏è Proposed fix > > ```diff > if daemon_script: > subprocess.Popen( > - ["uv", "run", "python", str(daemon_script), "start"], > + ["uv", "run", str(daemon_script), "start"], > stdout=subprocess.DEVNULL, > stderr=subprocess.DEVNULL, > cwd=str(daemon_script.parent.parent.parent), # opc/ dir > ) > ``` > >
> >
>
> .claude/hooks/premortem-suggest.py (1)
> > `15-17`: **Documentation is now outdated.** > > These lines reference `python3` invocation, but with this PR the hooks are now invoked via `uv run` through `hook_launcher.py`. Consider updating the cross-platform notes to reflect the new execution model. > >
> üìù Suggested documentation update > > ```diff > Cross-platform: > -- macOS/Linux: Called via `python3` in settings.json > -- Windows: Change settings.json to use `py -3` or `python` instead > +- All platforms: Called via `uv run` through hook_launcher.py > +- Fallback: If uv not available, uses python3 (or python on Windows) > ``` >
> >
>
> .claude/hooks/hook_launcher.py (1)
> > `1-32`: **Missing PEP 723 metadata in `hook_launcher.py` itself.** > > Since `settings.json` invokes this file via `uv run $HOME/.claude/hooks/hook_launcher.py`, this script should also include PEP 723 inline metadata to declare its Python version requirement. Currently it only has the standard shebang. > >
> üìù Suggested fix > > ```diff > #!/usr/bin/env python3 > +# /// script > +# requires-python = ">=3.10" > +# dependencies = [] > +# /// > """Cross-platform hook launcher for Claude Code hooks. > ``` >
> >
> >
ü§ñ Fix all issues with AI agents ``` In @.claude/hooks/post-tool-use-tracker.py: - Around line 1-5: Shebang line is incorrect for this repo's PR objectives; replace the current first-line shebang with the required invocation string "#!/usr/bin/env -S uv run" so the script uses the project's specified runner; update the top of the file (the existing shebang in .claude/hooks/post-tool-use-tracker.py) accordingly, keeping the PEP 723 metadata block and dependencies list unchanged. In @.claude/hooks/session_start_continuity.py: - Around line 1-5: Replace the current shebang line with the project-standard shebang "#!/usr/bin/env -S uv run" so the script is executed via the PR-required runner; ensure this new shebang is the very first line of the file (replacing the existing "#!/usr/bin/env python3") and keep the rest of the PEP 723 metadata block unchanged. In @.claude/hooks/session-symbol-index.py: - Around line 1-5: Update the script shebang to match the PR objectives by replacing the current first line "#!/usr/bin/env python3" with "#!/usr/bin/env -S uv run" so the file uses the required launcher; keep the rest of the PEP 723 metadata block and empty dependencies list unchanged. In @.claude/settings.json: - Line 4: The settings entry uses a direct invocation "uv run $HOME/.claude/scripts/status.py" which is inconsistent with other hooks that route through hook_launcher.py; update this to use the same launcher pattern by invoking hook_launcher.py (or adjust the launcher to accept status.py) so all Python hooks follow a uniform launch path‚Äîlocate the command string for status.py and replace the direct "uv run ..." invocation with the hook_launcher-based invocation used elsewhere, ensuring any required arguments or environment handling for status.py are preserved. ```
üìú Review details **Configuration used**: Organization UI **Review profile**: ASSERTIVE **Plan**: Pro **Knowledge base: Disabled due to `Reviews -> Disable Knowledge Base` setting**
üì• Commits Reviewing files that changed from the base of the PR and between 49cef1012da794a7563d16ded83a1e6ef8d59693 and 3d50026169c1bdad7c2dc665b464cfc0a85d5be0.
üìí Files selected for processing (10) * `.claude/hooks/auto-handoff-stop.py` * `.claude/hooks/braintrust_hooks.py` * `.claude/hooks/hook_launcher.py` * `.claude/hooks/post-tool-use-tracker.py` * `.claude/hooks/post_tool_use_tracker.py` * `.claude/hooks/pre_compact_continuity.py` * `.claude/hooks/premortem-suggest.py` * `.claude/hooks/session-symbol-index.py` * `.claude/hooks/session_start_continuity.py` * `.claude/settings.json`
üîá Additional comments (11)
.claude/hooks/pre_compact_continuity.py (2)
`1-1`: **Clarify shebang strategy.** The PR objectives state that scripts should use `#!/usr/bin/env -S uv run` as the shebang, but this file retains `#!/usr/bin/env python3`. Is this intentional (to provide a fallback when scripts are executed directly) or an oversight? If execution via `uv run` only happens at the settings.json/hook_launcher.py level, the current shebang is fine. Otherwise, consider updating to align with the stated PR objectives. --- `2-5`: **PEP 723 metadata is correct.** The inline script metadata follows the correct syntax and is properly supported by `uv run`. The configuration accurately specifies: - Python >=3.10 requirement (needed for PEP 604 union syntax like `str | None` used throughout) - Empty dependencies array (script uses only standard library)
.claude/hooks/braintrust_hooks.py (2)
`1-1`: **Clarify shebang strategy.** Same as pre_compact_continuity.py: the PR objectives mention `#!/usr/bin/env -S uv run` but the file retains `#!/usr/bin/env python3`. Confirm whether this is intentional or an oversight. --- `2-5`: **PEP 723 metadata correctly declares httpx dependency.** The metadata properly specifies: - Python >=3.10 requirement (for PEP 604 union syntax, confirmed by `str | None` patterns in the code) - httpx dependency (imported at line 33 and used for Braintrust API calls: GET `/v1/project` and POST `/v1/project_logs/{project_id}/insert`) uv supports PEP 723 and will auto-install the httpx dependency when running `uv run`.
.claude/hooks/post_tool_use_tracker.py (2)
`2-5`: **PEP 723 metadata is correct and consistent.** The metadata accurately declares: - Python >=3.10 requirement (matches PEP 604 union syntax usage) - Empty dependencies (uses only standard library: subprocess, json, pathlib, etc.) The metadata format is consistent across all three hook files in this PR. --- `1-1`: **Clarify shebang strategy.** Same shebang discrepancy as the other files: PR objectives state `#!/usr/bin/env -S uv run` but the file retains `#!/usr/bin/env python3`. Confirm this is intentional.
.claude/hooks/auto-handoff-stop.py (1)
`2-6`: **LGTM - PEP 723 metadata correctly added.** The inline script metadata follows the correct format. The empty dependencies array is appropriate since the script only uses standard library modules (`json`, `sys`, `glob`).
.claude/hooks/premortem-suggest.py (1)
`2-5`: **LGTM - PEP 723 metadata correctly added.** The metadata format is correct and the empty dependencies array is consistent with the comment on line 19 stating the script uses only standard library.
.claude/hooks/hook_launcher.py (2)
`123-154`: **LGTM - `find_uv()` implementation is well-structured.** The function follows the same pattern as `find_node()` and `find_python()`, checking both `shutil.which` and common installation paths for cross-platform compatibility. The inclusion of `~/.cargo/bin` is appropriate since uv can be installed via cargo. --- `260-274`: **Remove this optimization suggestion‚Äîthe proposed detection mechanism is unreliable.** UV_PYTHON is a user-settable environment variable that uv respects as a configuration input (equivalent to the `--python` flag), not an automatic marker set by uv when running scripts. Checking `os.environ.get("UV_PYTHON")` will not reliably detect whether code is already running under `uv run`. This variable may or may not be set regardless of whether the process was invoked by uv, making the proposed optimization unsound. Additionally, the fallback to `sys.executable` when UV_PYTHON is present could break dependency resolution for PEP 723 scripts, since `sys.executable` in a nested uv context may not be the intended Python interpreter. While nested uv invocations do create minor subprocess overhead, there is no standard, reliable environment-based mechanism in uv to detect nested invocation. The current approach of preferring `uv run` when available is appropriate. > Likely an incorrect or invalid review comment.
.claude/settings.json (1)
`110-111`: **The double `uv run` invocation is by design for dependency management.** The settings do invoke `uv run hook_launcher.py`, which then calls `uv run` again for `.py` hooks. This pattern is intentional: hook_launcher.py uses the inner `uv run` to handle PEP 723 inline dependencies declared in individual hook scripts. Each hook can specify its own dependencies (e.g., `# /// script` metadata), and `uv run` ensures they're resolved. This approach allows hook_launcher.py to work regardless of how it's invoked (`python` directly or via `uv run`), making it a truly universal launcher. No refactoring needed‚Äîthe design is correct as-is.

**Actionable comments posted: 4** > [!CAUTION] > Some comments are outside the diff and can‚Äôt be posted inline due to platform limitations. > > > >
> ‚ö†Ô∏è Outside diff range comments (4)
> >
> .claude/hooks/auto-handoff-stop.py (2)
> > `17-17`: **Consider using a context manager for file operations.** > > The file is opened without a context manager, which can leave the file handle open until garbage collection. While the script exits immediately after, using a context manager is best practice. > > > >
> ‚ôªÔ∏è Suggested improvement > > ```diff > - pct = int(open(ctx_files[0]).read().strip()) > + with open(ctx_files[0]) as f: > + pct = int(f.read().strip()) > ``` >
> > --- > > `24-24`: **Replace bare except with specific exception handling.** > > The bare `except:` clause catches all exceptions, including `KeyboardInterrupt` and `SystemExit`, which can mask unexpected errors and make debugging harder. > > > >
> ‚ôªÔ∏è Suggested improvement > > ```diff > - except: pass > + except Exception: > + pass > ``` >
> >
>
> .claude/hooks/session_start_continuity.py (1)
> > `241-248`: **Hardcoded `uv` command may fail silently when uv is not installed.** > > This `Popen` call uses `"uv"` directly without checking if uv is available, but stderr/stdout are sent to DEVNULL. If uv is not installed, the call will fail and return "Memory daemon: Started" (misleading), or raise `FileNotFoundError` which is caught but returns `None` instead of an error message. > > Consider using the `find_uv()` helper from `hook_launcher.py` or adding a fallback to direct Python execution, similar to how `hook_launcher.py` handles this. > > > >
> Suggested approach > > ```diff > +from .hook_launcher import find_uv, find_python > + > def ensure_memory_daemon() -> str | None: > # ... existing code ... > > if daemon_script: > - subprocess.Popen( > - ["uv", "run", "python", str(daemon_script), "start"], > - stdout=subprocess.DEVNULL, > - stderr=subprocess.DEVNULL, > - cwd=str(daemon_script.parent.parent.parent), # opc/ dir > - ) > + uv_path = shutil.which("uv") > + if uv_path: > + cmd = [uv_path, "run", "python", str(daemon_script), "start"] > + else: > + python_path = shutil.which("python3") or shutil.which("python") > + if not python_path: > + return None > + cmd = [python_path, str(daemon_script), "start"] > + subprocess.Popen( > + cmd, > + stdout=subprocess.DEVNULL, > + stderr=subprocess.DEVNULL, > + cwd=str(daemon_script.parent.parent.parent), > + ) > return "Memory daemon: Started" > ``` >
> >
>
> .claude/hooks/hook_launcher.py (1)
> > `1-5`: **Consider adding PEP 723 metadata to hook_launcher.py itself.** > > Since `hook_launcher.py` is invoked via `uv run` from `settings.json`, it should include PEP 723 metadata for consistency and to ensure `uv` can properly manage its execution environment. While it only uses stdlib modules, adding the metadata makes the intent explicit. > > > >
> Suggested metadata header > > ```diff > #!/usr/bin/env python3 > +# /// script > +# requires-python = ">=3.10" > +# dependencies = [] > +# /// > """Cross-platform hook launcher for Claude Code hooks. > ``` >
> >
> >
ü§ñ Fix all issues with AI agents ``` In @.claude/hooks/auto-handoff-stop.py: - Around line 1-5: Update the PEP 723 metadata `requires-python` declaration from ">=3.9" to ">=3.10" in the hook metadata block (the `requires-python` line in the shebang/metadata header) so the hook matches other hooks in the `.claude/hooks/` directory and the project standard. In @.claude/hooks/premortem-suggest.py: - Around line 2-5: Update the script metadata so the Python requirement matches the code's actual syntax: change the requires-python value from ">=3.10" to ">=3.9". This aligns with the use of built-in generic types like list[str] (see occurrences around the list[str] hints) which require Python 3.9+, and keeps everything else unchanged. In @.claude/hooks/session-symbol-index.py: - Around line 2-5: The requires-python metadata currently says ">=3.10" but the script uses only older stdlib features; update the header's requires-python value in the script metadata (the "requires-python" key at the top of .claude/hooks/session-symbol-index.py) to a lower constraint such as ">=3.8" (or ">=3.9" if your repo prefers) so it accurately reflects the minimum Python version; keep the rest of the header unchanged. In @.claude/settings.json: - Line 4: The command string "command": "uv run $HOME/.claude/scripts/status.py" in settings.json uses the unsupported $HOME variable; update this entry to avoid variable expansion by replacing $HOME with an absolute path or a relative path (e.g., "/home/youruser/.claude/scripts/status.py" or "./.claude/scripts/status.py"), or move the environment variable setup into the "env" section and reference a plain path in "command"; ensure the final "command" value contains no shell variable references. ```
üìú Review details **Configuration used**: Organization UI **Review profile**: ASSERTIVE **Plan**: Pro **Knowledge base: Disabled due to `Reviews -> Disable Knowledge Base` setting**
üì• Commits Reviewing files that changed from the base of the PR and between 3d50026169c1bdad7c2dc665b464cfc0a85d5be0 and f379a1595f33eedaf3cdf10c19ad7bcce501c081.
üìí Files selected for processing (10) * `.claude/hooks/auto-handoff-stop.py` * `.claude/hooks/braintrust_hooks.py` * `.claude/hooks/hook_launcher.py` * `.claude/hooks/post-tool-use-tracker.py` * `.claude/hooks/post_tool_use_tracker.py` * `.claude/hooks/pre_compact_continuity.py` * `.claude/hooks/premortem-suggest.py` * `.claude/hooks/session-symbol-index.py` * `.claude/hooks/session_start_continuity.py` * `.claude/settings.json`
üîá Additional comments (10)
.claude/hooks/auto-handoff-stop.py (1)
`6-6`: **Good addition of module documentation.** The docstring clearly describes the hook's purpose.
.claude/hooks/post_tool_use_tracker.py (1)
`2-5`: **PEP 723 metadata correctly added with accurate version requirement.** The script metadata is properly formatted. The `requires-python = ">=3.10"` requirement is correct because the code uses the union type operator syntax (`str | None` at line 100, `int | None` at line 180), which requires Python 3.10+. The `from __future__ import annotations` on line 15 defers annotation evaluation but doesn't backport the `|` operator syntax to earlier versions.
.claude/hooks/post-tool-use-tracker.py (1)
`1-5`: **PEP 723 metadata header looks good.** The script metadata block is correctly formatted with `requires-python = ">=3.10"` and an empty `dependencies` array, which is appropriate since only standard library modules are used. This aligns with the PR's goal of enabling `uv run` execution.
.claude/hooks/braintrust_hooks.py (1)
`1-5`: **PEP 723 metadata correctly declares the httpx dependency.** The `dependencies = ["httpx"]` declaration enables `uv run` to automatically install this package when the hook is invoked, which addresses the PR's motivation of handling missing dependencies gracefully.
.claude/hooks/session_start_continuity.py (1)
`2-5`: **PEP 723 metadata header is correct.** The empty `dependencies` array is appropriate since only standard library modules are used.
.claude/settings.json (1)
`110-112`: **Settings consistently updated to use `uv run` for Python hooks.** The hook commands are consistently updated to invoke `uv run $HOME/.claude/hooks/hook_launcher.py `. This aligns with the PR objective of using uv for portable Python execution. Note that if uv is not installed on a system, these hooks will fail. This is the intended behavior per the PR motivation (systems should have uv installed for the new workflow). Also applies to: 149-151, 209-211, 249-250
.claude/hooks/pre_compact_continuity.py (1)
`1-5`: **PEP 723 metadata header is correctly formatted.** The empty `dependencies` array is appropriate since only standard library modules are used.
.claude/hooks/hook_launcher.py (3)
`17-28`: **Documentation clearly explains PEP 723 metadata requirements for Python hooks.** The updated docstring provides clear guidance on including inline script metadata for portability. This is helpful for contributors adding new Python hooks. --- `123-154`: **Well-implemented `find_uv()` function with comprehensive path search.** The function correctly: - Checks `shutil.which()` first (respects PATH) - Searches common Windows install locations (`LOCALAPPDATA`, `USERPROFILE/.local/bin`) - Searches common Unix install locations (`~/.local/bin`, `~/.cargo/bin`) This mirrors the pattern used by `find_node()` and provides good cross-platform coverage. --- `260-274`: **Correct fallback logic for Python hook execution.** The implementation properly prefers `uv run` for handling PEP 723 dependencies, with a graceful fallback to direct Python execution. The error message at line 272 is helpful, recommending uv as the preferred option.

**Actionable comments posted: 3** > [!CAUTION] > Some comments are outside the diff and can‚Äôt be posted inline due to platform limitations. > > > >
> ‚ö†Ô∏è Outside diff range comments (2)
> >
> .claude/hooks/session_start_continuity.py (2)
> > `128-132`: **Resource leak: File handle not properly closed.** > > The `open()` call for `log_file` is passed directly to `Popen.stdout` without a context manager. If `Popen` fails, the file handle leaks. > > > >
> Suggested fix > > ```diff > # Start background indexing > + log_handle = open(log_file, "w") > subprocess.Popen( > ["tldr", "warm", "--project", project_dir], > - stdout=open(log_file, "w"), > + stdout=log_handle, > stderr=subprocess.STDOUT, > ) > + # Note: log_handle intentionally not closed - it's owned by the subprocess > ``` > > Alternatively, if the subprocess should detach completely: > > ```diff > # Start background indexing > - subprocess.Popen( > - ["tldr", "warm", "--project", project_dir], > - stdout=open(log_file, "w"), > - stderr=subprocess.STDOUT, > - ) > + with open(log_file, "w") as log_handle: > + subprocess.Popen( > + ["tldr", "warm", "--project", project_dir], > + stdout=log_handle, > + stderr=subprocess.STDOUT, > + ) > ``` > >
> > --- > > `186-190`: **Same resource leak pattern as above.** > > The `open(log_file, "w")` passed to `Popen.stdout` has the same leak risk. > > > >
> Suggested fix > > ```diff > log_file = tldr_dir / "semantic_indexing.log" > - subprocess.Popen( > - ["tldr", "semantic", "index", project_dir], > - stdout=open(log_file, "w"), > - stderr=subprocess.STDOUT, > - ) > + with open(log_file, "w") as log_handle: > + subprocess.Popen( > + ["tldr", "semantic", "index", project_dir], > + stdout=log_handle, > + stderr=subprocess.STDOUT, > + ) > ``` > >
> >
> >
ü§ñ Fix all issues with AI agents ``` In @.claude/hooks/auto-handoff-stop.py: - Around line 25-26: The bare "except Exception: pass" in the auto-handoff-stop hook silently swallows errors and triggers S110/BLE001; replace it by catching specific expected exceptions (e.g., FileNotFoundError, OSError, ValueError) around the failing operation and handle them explicitly, and for any unexpected exception either log it via the existing logger or re-raise after logging; update the except block that currently reads "except Exception: pass" to list the specific exception types and add minimal logging for unexpected cases. - Around line 14-18: The code uses glob.glob to collect ctx_files and then opens ctx_files[0], which is non-deterministic when multiple matches exist; change the selection to pick the most recently modified file (e.g., compute latest = max(ctx_files, key=os.path.getmtime) or sort by os.path.getmtime and take the last) and open that file instead of ctx_files[0] so you reliably read the newest claude-context-pct-*.txt. In @.claude/hooks/hook_launcher.py: - Around line 127-158: The Windows install path LOCALAPPDATA/Programs/uv/uv.exe in find_uv() is non-standard; update the common_paths list used in the sys.platform == "win32" branch to remove the LOCALAPPDATA entry and keep (or explicitly prefer) Path(os.environ.get("USERPROFILE", "")) / ".local" / "bin" / "uv.exe" (and add a brief inline comment that ~/.local/bin/uv.exe is the official default) so the function only checks the documented default Windows location; adjust references to common_paths and the p.exists() loop accordingly. ```
üìú Review details **Configuration used**: Organization UI **Review profile**: ASSERTIVE **Plan**: Pro **Knowledge base: Disabled due to `Reviews -> Disable Knowledge Base` setting**
üì• Commits Reviewing files that changed from the base of the PR and between f379a1595f33eedaf3cdf10c19ad7bcce501c081 and d30a158c7a8905e579967a25832d487d719001b4.
üìí Files selected for processing (4) * `.claude/hooks/auto-handoff-stop.py` * `.claude/hooks/hook_launcher.py` * `.claude/hooks/premortem-suggest.py` * `.claude/hooks/session_start_continuity.py`
üß∞ Additional context used
üß¨ Code graph analysis (1)
.claude/hooks/auto-handoff-stop.py (1)
.claude/hooks/dist/skill-activation-prompt.mjs (1) * `pct` (490-490)
ü™õ Ruff (0.14.10)
.claude/hooks/session_start_continuity.py 243-243: Starting a process with a partial executable path (S607)
.claude/hooks/auto-handoff-stop.py 25-26: `try`-`except`-`pass` detected, consider logging the exception (S110) --- 25-25: Do not catch blind exception: `Exception` (BLE001)
üîá Additional comments (8)
.claude/hooks/premortem-suggest.py (2)
`2-5`: **LGTM!** The PEP 723 inline script metadata is correctly formatted and aligns with the standardization to `requires-python = ">=3.10"` across hooks. Empty dependencies array is appropriate since the script uses only the standard library. --- `16-17`: **LGTM!** Documentation accurately reflects the new `uv run` invocation pattern and the fallback mechanism for environments without uv installed.
.claude/hooks/session_start_continuity.py (2)
`2-5`: **LGTM: PEP 723 metadata added for consistency.** The inline script metadata block aligns with the PR's goal of standardizing Python hooks for `uv run` execution. Empty dependencies list is appropriate since this script uses only stdlib modules. --- `243-243`: **Correct fix: Remove redundant "python" argument from `uv run`.** With PEP 723 inline metadata, `uv run ` directly executes Python scripts without needing an explicit `python` interpreter argument. This change is correct.
.claude/hooks/auto-handoff-stop.py (2)
`1-6`: **LGTM: Proper uv run shebang and PEP 723 metadata.** The shebang `#!/usr/bin/env -S uv run` with PEP 723 inline metadata enables portable execution. Empty dependencies are correct for stdlib-only usage. --- `10-11`: **LGTM: Short-circuit prevents recursive hook invocation.** This guard prevents infinite loops if the hook system inadvertently re-triggers this stop hook.
.claude/hooks/hook_launcher.py (2)
`2-5`: **LGTM: PEP 723 metadata for the launcher itself.** Adding inline script metadata to the launcher ensures it can also be executed via `uv run` if needed, maintaining consistency with the hooks it launches. --- `264-278`: **LGTM: Clean uv-first execution with Python fallback.** The implementation correctly: 1. Prefers `uv run` for PEP 723 dependency handling 2. Falls back to direct Python when uv is unavailable 3. Provides a clear error message when neither is found This aligns with the PR objective of using uv while maintaining backward compatibility.
